author: Lizzie Porter
title: Thomas Cook hand luggage restrictions
text: How many pieces of luggage can I bring in the cabin with me? One, free of charge. Size : 55cm x 40cm x 20cm. Trunki’s rolling suitcases are acceptable for children. Weight : 6kg Can I book a hold bag on a single leg, and travel hand-luggage only on the other? It's complicated. The Thomas Cook "FlexibleTrips" tickets allow passengers the option of booking hold luggage on specific legs of a trip, whereas Thomas Cook "Style Collection" offerings have hold luggage included and no discount will be given for not travelling with hold luggage on one leg of a trip. Am I allowed any items in addition to my one cabin bag? In addition to the one 6kg bag, passengers may carry one of the following items in the cabin with them: one laptop, one overcoat or one blanket, one small ladies handbag or one small wrist-bag or one small bag with shoulder strap; one umbrella, one small camera and/or one pair of binoculars, assisted devices for those with disabilities, a "reasonable amount" of reading material for the flight, duty free items purchased at the airport beyond security checks, or as a pre-order from the operating carrier; infants' food for consumption during the flight. Related Articles Virgin Atlantic hand luggage restrictions 03 Aug 2015 Monarch cabin luggage restrictions 03 Aug 2015 easyJet hand luggage restrictions 03 Aug 2015 Thomson hand luggage restrictions 03 Aug 2015 Anything else? Infants do not have a cabin luggage allowance and all baby supplies including milk must be carried within the accompanying adult's 6kg luggage allowance. Read Thomas Cook's full cabin baggage allowance guidelines .
